name: chromepolicy_customers_policies_networks_defineCertificate
description: Creates a certificate at a specified OU for a customer.

customer.description: Required. The customer for which the certificate will apply.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

GoogleChromePolicyVersionsV1DefineCertif.description: Request object for creating a certificate.

ceritificateName.description: Optional. The optional name of the certificate. If not specified, the certificate issuer will be used as the name.

certificate.description: Required. The raw contents of the .PEM, .CRT, or .CER file.

settings.description: Optional. Certificate settings within the chrome.networks.certificates namespace.

targetResource.description: Required. The target resource on which this certificate is applied. The following resources are supported: * Organizational Unit ("orgunits/{orgunit_id}")

GoogleChromePolicyVersionsV1NetworkSetti.description: A network setting contains network configurations.

policySchema.description: The fully qualified name of the network setting.

value.description: The value of the network setting.

$block: Response object for creating a certificate.

$ul: **networkId**: The guid of the certificate created by the action.
**settings**: the affiliated settings of the certificate (NOT IMPLEMENTED)
**targetResource**: the resource at which the certificate is defined.
